## Scenario 2: Focus on detection

- Focus on species for which (also) scope detection is relevant
  - Absent & sporadically present species
  - Widespread species absent from conservation areas (prius-stadium 'REL-AAN-GEV-VER-BUI')

- Motivation
  - Importance of intervening in early vs. late invasion stage
  - EU IAS regulation highlights early detection & rapid response ('surveillance')
    - But: responsibility of federal government for detection


::: {.notes}
- INBO: enkel detectie indien soort in natuur opduikt
- introductieplaatsen moeten gekend zijn en voldoende specifiek en lokaal (ook al als filter criterium gebruikt)
- detectie in natuurgebieden moet van belang zijn

:::

## Scenario 2: Focus on detection (animals)

- Larger groups for scope detection
  - Group 1
    - 6 aquatic species (3 fish, Muskusrat, Californische rivierkreeft, Noord-atlantische zeester)
    - Aquatic eDNA, and for the fish electric fishing, trapping & netting
  - Group 2
    - A number of terrestrial species (mammals, birds, other)
    - Camera traps, and partly visual surveys
    - Heterogeneous group
- We suggest to analyse for the aquatic group how the scope detection could be filled in
